item.title: 法院阻止加州关于儿童网络安全的法律
item.description: 一名联邦法官称，加利福尼亚州不能执行一项旨在保护儿童免受可能对其身心造成伤害的在线内容影响的州法律。【原文：A federal judge said California cannot enforce a state law meant to shield children from online content that could harm them mentally or physically.】

item.title: 联邦特工搜查哥伦比亚大学两处学生宿舍
item.description: 联邦特工搜查了哥伦比亚大学的两处学生宿舍，该校临时校长说，一周前移民特工拘留了去年校园抗议活动的领导人马哈茂德-哈利勒（Mahmoud Khalil），特朗普政府希望将其驱逐出境。【原文：Federal agents searched two student residences at Columbia University, its interim president said, a week after immigration agents detained Mahmoud Khalil, a leader of last year's campus protests, who the Trump administration wants to deport.】

item.title: 作为特朗普提名的医疗保险候选人，电视主持人奥兹医生将回答冲突问题
item.description: 被唐纳德-特朗普总统提名负责监督医疗保险和医疗补助计划的名医、前共和党美国参议院候选人麦赫麦特-奥兹博士（Dr. Mehmet Oz）预计将在周五接受有关可能造成利益冲突的行业关系的提问。【原文：Dr. Mehmet Oz, the celebrity physician and former Republican U.S. Senate candidate nominated by President Donald Trump to oversee Medicare and Medicaid, is expected to field questions on Friday on industry ties that could create conflicts of interest.】

item.title: 致命碰撞事故发生后，美国联邦航空局（FAA）对华盛顿州直升机交通发布永久性限制措施
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周五表示，将对华盛顿里根国家机场周边的非必要直升机作业实施永久性限制，并取消直升机与客机的混合飞行。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration said Friday it is imposing permanently restrictions on non-essential helicopter operations around Washington Reagan National Airport and eliminating helicopter and passenger jet mixed traffic.】

item.title: 美国教育部称正在调查 45 所大学
item.description: 美国教育部周五表示，其民权办公室正在对 45 所大学进行调查。【原文：The U.S. Department of Education on Friday said its office for civil rights is investigating 45 universities.】

item.title: 哈马斯将释放在加沙的美国人质，为第二阶段停火谈判做好准备
item.description: 哈马斯周五表示，在收到调解人关于继续就停火协议第二阶段进行谈判的建议后，同意释放一名美以双重国籍者，据信他是最后一名被关押在加沙的在世美国人质。【原文：Hamas said on Friday it agreed to release an American-Israeli dual national, believed to be the last living American hostage held in Gaza, after receiving a proposal from mediators to continue negotiations on the second phase of a ceasefire deal.】

item.title: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）和太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）再次尝试发射火箭，准备带回被困宇航员
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）和美国太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）周五将倒计时发射期待已久的载人火箭，让他们把在国际空间站滞留了九个月的美国宇航员布奇-威尔莫尔（Butch Wilmore）和苏尼-威廉姆斯（Suni Williams）带回家。【原文：NASA and SpaceX on Friday will count down to a long-awaited crewed rocket launch that will allow them to bring home U.S. astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who have been stuck on the International Space Station for nine months.】

item.title: 在各机构提交裁员计划后，白宫希望继续大规模裁员
item.description: 在各机构被要求提交大规模裁员计划之后，特朗普政府预计将于周五在美国联邦政府内实施第二波大规模解雇和预算削减。【原文：The Trump administration is expected on Friday to move ahead with a second wave of mass firings and budget cuts across the U.S. federal government after agencies were told to submit large-scale downsizing plans.】

item.title: 美国参议院准备通过共和党临时支出法案，避免停摆
item.description: 美国参议院周五准备通过一项临时支出法案，避免政府部分停摆，此前民主党人在对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统裁减联邦工作人员的竞选活动感到愤怒而导致的僵局中退让。【原文：The U.S. Senate on Friday was poised to pass a stopgap spending bill and avert a partial government shutdown, after Democrats backed down in a standoff driven by anger over President Donald Trump's campaign to slash the federal workforce.】

item.title: 随着审判临近，肖恩-康姆斯（Sean 'Diddy' Combs）将因新起诉被传讯
item.description: 肖恩-迪迪-康姆斯（Sean Diddy Combs）预计将于本周五就新的起诉书出庭受审，新的起诉书增加了对这位嘻哈大亨强迫员工长时间工作的指控，并威胁要惩罚那些不协助其二十年性交易计划的人。【原文：Sean Diddy Combs is expected on Friday to be arraigned in court on a new indictment, which added accusations that the hip-hop mogul forced employees to work long hours and threatened to punish those who did not assist in his two-decade sex trafficking scheme.】

item.title: 据 Axios 报道，美国移民和海关执法局全年资金短缺 20 亿美元
item.description: 美国移民和海关执法局（ICE）警告国会本财年资金缺口达 20 亿美元，Axios 周五援引两位知情人士的话报道。【原文：The United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has warned Congress has a funding shortfall of $2 billion for this fiscal year, Axios reported on Friday, citing two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家新闻美国将任命高级外交官为中国大使馆代办美国国务院
item.description: 美国国务院表示，在华盛顿任命的大使人选戴维-珀杜（David Perdue）等待参议院确认期间，美国国务院将任命一名高级外交官，负责监督其驻北京大使馆和驻华领事馆的1300名工作人员。【原文：The U.S. State Department said it will install a senior diplomat to oversee its 1,300-strong embassy in Beijing and consulates in China while Washington's ambassadorial pick David Perdue awaits Senate confirmation.】

item.title: 佛罗里达市长试图驱逐放映以色列-巴勒斯坦电影的电影院
item.description: 迈阿密海滩市市长史蒂文-迈纳（Steven Meiner）试图将一家艺术影院驱逐出城市地产，因为这家艺术影院放映了奥斯卡获奖影片《没有别的土地》（No Other Land），这部影片讲述了以色列在以色列占领的约旦河西岸驱赶一个巴勒斯坦社区的故事。【原文：Miami Beach Mayor Steven Meiner has sought to evict an art house cinema from city property for screening Oscar-winning "No Other Land," a film about the Israeli displacement of a Palestinian community in the Israeli-occupied West Bank.】

item.title: 佛罗里达市长试图驱逐放映以色列-巴勒斯坦电影的电影院

item.title: No injuries reported after American Airlines plane fire in Denver, Fox affiliate says
item.description: Passengers were evacuated Thursday evening from an American Airlines plane on the ground in Denver after a fire was reported, a Fox affiliate said, adding no injuries were reported.

item.title: Vance says you never can predict future, when asked to rule out recession -Fox News
item.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance on Thursday told Fox News' "The Ingraham Angle" that you can never predict the future, when asked during an interview if he could rule out a recession.

item.title: Trump administration is defying court order over anti-DEI policy, groups say
item.description: U.S. agencies are defying a court order blocking President Donald Trump's ban on diversity, equity and inclusion programs at businesses and organizations that contract with the federal government, groups suing over the ban said in a court filing on Thursday.

item.title: Newsmax agreed to pay $40 million to settle defamation suit over 2020 false election claims
item.description: Newsmax Media has agreed to pay $40 million to settle allegations it defamed Smartmatic by reporting false claims that the voting machine company helped rig the 2020 U.S. election for Joe Biden over Donald Trump, according to a filing.

item.title: Columbia University punishes pro-Palestinian protesters who occupied building
item.description: Columbia University on Thursday said it had doled out a range of punishments to students who occupied a campus building last spring during pro-Palestinian protests.

item.title: Johns Hopkins University slashes 2,000 jobs after Trump administration grant cut
item.description: The Johns Hopkins University said on Thursday it will slash over 2,000 jobs in the U.S. and abroad after the administration of President Donald Trump terminated $800 million in grants to the renowned academic institution.

item.title: US Senate Democrats to clear way for stopgap bill, avert shutdown, Punchbowl News reports
item.description: Top U.S. Senate Democrat Chuck Schumer told colleagues behind closed doors on Thursday that he would vote to advance a stopgap funding bill, signaling that his party would provide the votes to avert a government shutdown, Punchbowl News reported, citing Democratic aides and lawmakers.

item.title: Elon Musk visits US National Security Agency amid ongoing DOGE cuts
item.description: Elon Musk, who is leading the Trump administration's effort to cut and streamline the federal government's workforce, visited the National Security Agency on Wednesday to meet with the NSA's head, a spokesperson for the agency told Reuters.

item.title: CERAWEEK Next round of inspections in Eaton Fire expected next week, Edison Intl CEO
item.description: Southern California Edison will begin its first close-up physical inspections of certain power equipment under investigation for possible links to the start of the Eaton Fire in Los Angeles early this year, Edison International CEO Pedro Pizarro told Reuters at the CERAWeek conference in Houston on Thursday.

item.title: US public broadcasting entity sues FEMA over emergency alert funding freeze
item.description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting, which provides funding to PBS and NPR stations, sued the U.S. Federal Emergency Management Agency on Thursday to lift a freeze on funds meant to support the country's emergency alert system.

item.title: Democratic congressman Raúl Grijalva of Arizona dead at 77
item.description: Democratic U.S. Representative Raúl Grijalva, who represented Arizona for more than 20 years, died on Thursday at the age of 77 due to complications from cancer treatments, his office said in a statement.

item.title: 据 ABC 新闻报道，白宫将联邦调查局高级职员的背景调查移交给五角大楼
item.description: 美国广播公司（ABC）周四援引知情人士的话报道称，白宫已指示联邦调查局停止对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的数十名高级幕僚进行背景调查，并将这一程序移交给五角大楼。【原文：The White House has directed the FBI to stop conducting background checks into dozens of U.S. President Donald Trump's top staffers, and to transfer the process to the Pentagon, ABC News reported Thursday, citing sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 五角大楼泄密者杰克-特谢拉承认犯有妨碍军事行动罪
item.description: 杰克-特谢拉（Jack Teixeira）是马萨诸塞州空军国民警卫队的一名成员，因在网上泄露美国国家安全机密文件而被判 15 年监禁。【原文：Jack Teixeira, a member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard who is serving a 15-year prison sentence for leaking classified U.S. national security documents online, on Thursday pleaded guilty to military charges of obstructing justice.】

item.title: 五角大楼泄密者杰克-特谢拉承认犯有妨碍军事行动罪
item.description: 杰克-特谢拉（Jack Teixeira）是马萨诸塞州空军国民警卫队的一名成员，因在网上泄露美国国家安全机密文件而被判 15 年监禁。【原文：Jack Teixeira, a member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard who is serving a 15-year prison sentence for leaking classified U.S. national security documents online, on Thursday pleaded guilty to military charges of obstructing justice.】

item.title: 卢特尼克称特朗普希望在预算平衡时免除收入低于 15 万美元者的税收--福克斯新闻
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周四告诉福克斯新闻（Fox News），美国总统唐纳德-特朗普希望在平衡预算后免除收入低于15万美元的美国人的税收。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump would like to waive taxes for Americans earning under $150,000 once he balances the budget, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told Fox News on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国批准扩建蒙大拿州煤矿
item.description: 内政部周四在一份声明中说，特朗普政府批准了一项扩建蒙大拿州煤矿并将其寿命延长16年的计划。【原文：The Trump administration approved a plan to expand a Montana coal mine and extend its life by 16 years, the Interior Department said in a statement on Thursday.】
